page.title: 01Introduction to the area.
page.content: Our grid is about 20 miles west of London and lies in the Thames Valley.The western half of the area is all within Windsor Great Park.The eastern part is semi-rural with two built up areas,the villages of Old Windsor and Englefield Green.Cooper's Hill,98 metres above sea level,is the highest point and the topography is generally hilly with a slope running down to the Thames. On the banks of the Thames is the Runnymede area which is a popular attraction for tourists and is administered by the National Trust. Although there are two hospitals,several schools and a few small shopping parades the area is not self sufficient and the inhabitants rely heavily on the facilities of the surrounding towns of Egham,Windsor,Staines and Slough.
